meta.title: Alexander Morozov — Full-Stack Developer
meta.description: Custom CRM systems, corporate websites, and web applications. From architecture design to production deployment. React, Next.js, Node.js, integrations with 1C, marketplaces, payment systems. Direct collaboration, transparent terms, demos at every stage.

hero.name: Alexander Morozov
hero.description: I build comprehensive CRM systems, corporate websites, and web applications from scratch. Modernize legacy projects with data migration and redesign. Integrations with 1C, marketplaces, payment systems. Long-term production support. Direct collaboration, transparent terms, demos at every stage.

crm.title: CRM Systems
crm.description: Business management web apps: customer, order, and task tracking. Interactive dashboards, analytics, integrations

web.title: Web Applications
web.description: Corporate websites, client portals, admin panels, e-commerce, landing pages

api.title: Backend & Integrations
api.description: Server-side logic, payment system and third-party integrations, site search, hosting setup

support.title: Support
support.description: Long-term maintenance, feature development, optimization, fast resolution of critical issues

brief.title: Brief
brief.description: We discuss the task, define requirements, timeline, and budget. Create technical specifications.

design.title: Design
design.description: I develop the architecture, create interface prototypes, and align on design.

development.title: Development
development.description: Writing clean code, testing. Regular demos and feedback loops.

launch.title: Launch
launch.description: Deploy to server, set up monitoring. Training and documentation.

technologies.question: What technologies do you use?
technologies.answer: Frontend: React and Next.js. Backend: Node.js with NestJS or Express, Strapi CMS for content sites. Database: PostgreSQL, Redis caching, full-text search. Cloud storage for files. Integrations: Telegram bots, SMS, payment systems, AI services. Docker containerization, CI/CD. All code in TypeScript. I choose the stack based on the task.

timeline.question: How long does development take?
timeline.answer: Landing page or small website — 1-2 weeks. Medium complexity CRM system — 2-3 months. Timeline depends on functionality scope and approval speed. Exact timeline discussed after reviewing requirements.

cost.question: How is pricing determined?
cost.answer: I estimate after reviewing requirements. Work on fixed price per project or hourly rate for long-term collaboration. 30-50% upfront, remainder upon completion. All terms documented in contract.

support.question: Is there support after launch?
support.answer: Yes, I provide 1-3 months warranty support after launch. Bug fixes are free. Also offer long-term support: improvements, updates, monitoring — under separate agreement.

communication.question: How does communication work?
communication.answer: We communicate via Telegram or email. Weekly calls for progress demos. For each project I deploy a test version on a separate domain — you can view and test anytime. Access to repository. I respond during business hours within a few hours.

cavextable.title: Cavex CRM
cavextable.description: Comprehensive manufacturing management system with interactive floor maps, weighted peer evaluation system, and automated attendance tracking. Full development cycle from architecture to production launch.
highlights: Interactive SVG floor plans with availability view and booking
10-point peer evaluation system split into personal and professional qualities
Evaluation weights depend on the reviewer's role
Composite employee rating from three components with dynamics charts
Calendar view for administrators with attendance marks
Automatic seat assignment for those who forgot to book
Re-evaluation reminders on a 3-month cycle
Vacation management system
Redis caching, action logging with admin panel viewer
Multi-role access system, JWT authorization
imageAlts: Cavex CRM — schedule and workplace booking

manipeni.title: Manipeni CRM
manipeni.description: Full-cycle manufacturing CRM: from raw material to marketplace sales. Automatic salary calculation with complex tariffs, shipping company integrations, SMS notifications, built-in task manager and chats. Yandex Cloud storage.
highlights: Full product cycle: blank → step-by-step operations → media → catalog → sale → shipping
Manufacturing history for each item with all operation marks
Salary calculation by rates based on product, shape, size, area
Defect penalty system, real-time employee earnings table
Marketplace and shipping company integrations
SMS notifications to customers on shipping status
Sales commission for managers
Full inventory management
Chats, group conversations, built-in task manager
Web-push notifications
Knowledge base and video tutorials for the system
Media and document storage in Yandex Cloud
Revenue and expense analytics, receipt storage
Full mobile version, dark and light themes
Flexible role-based access system
imageAlts: Manipeni CRM — admin panel main screen

theater.title: Udmurt State Theater Website
theater.description: Complete redesign and modernization of a government institution's legacy website. Full content migration from MySQL, media transfer from old cloud storage, QuickTickets integration. Custom CMS with optimized admin panel. Bilingual support and accessibility mode compliant with state standards.
highlights: Complete legacy site redesign with full content preservation
Strapi CMS with custom hooks and endpoints for admin optimization
Convenient multilingual workflow (Russian/Udmurt)
Accessibility mode compliant with state standards
QuickTickets ticket service integration
Data migration from legacy MySQL database
Media migration from old cloud storage
Image optimization
Responsive design for desktop and mobile

aksprom.title: Aksprom B2B
aksprom.description: B2B platform for partners with full-text search (Manticore Search), personal pricing from 1C, and OAuth authentication. S3 media storage, PDF/Excel export, PWA. Partner accounts with order history. Feature-Sliced Design architecture.
features: Full-text search with fuzzy matching and suggestions
highlights: Full-text search over catalog with fuzzy matching, suggestions and partial-word search (Manticore Search)
Partners synced with 1C, personal prices by product groups
Catalog: brands, categories, features, stock
Media storage in S3-compatible object storage (MinIO)
Order placement, shipment statuses, delivery with addresses
Admin: products, partners, orders, users, brands, units, logs, SEO, files
Partner account with order history and counterparty filter
OAuth: Google, Yandex, GitHub, Mail.ru; JWT authorization
PDF and Excel export, PWA, React Email for transactional mail
Client: Next.js, Redux Toolkit, Ant Design, Feature-Sliced Design; server: NestJS, TypeORM, Redis

sellerpay.title: Sellerpay
sellerpay.description: Fintech platform for international money transfers with AI invoice recognition, digital signature registration, and payment system integration. SMS authentication, agent system with promo codes. Production-grade tools: Amplitude analytics, Graylog logging.
highlights: SMS-based authentication with Yandex Captcha protection
User registration via electronic digital signature (EDS)
International transfer requests: SWIFT, Alipay, WeChat Pay
AI-powered invoice recognition of any format using Yandex AI (OCR)
Automatic form filling from recognized invoices
Multi-level agent system with promo codes and referral chain tracking
PDF document generation for requests and reports
Admin panel for managing requests, users, and agents
Transactional email via Resend
Product analytics with Amplitude for user behavior tracking
Centralized logging with Graylog for system monitoring
Metrics integration: Yandex.Metrica, Mail.ru, VK
Multi-currency support and international payment systems
Production-ready architecture with monitoring and analytics
imageAlts: Sellerpay — agent system and promo codes
